metadata.title: YouTube vs Twitch 2025: Which Platform for Streaming?
metadata.description: Compare YouTube and Twitch for live streaming. Monetization, discoverability, and which platform fits your content.

hero.headline: YouTube vs Twitch: Where Should You Stream?
hero.subheadline: Two streaming giants with different strengths. Find the platform that fits your content and goals.

sections.content: YouTube and Twitch dominate live streaming, but with very different approaches. Twitch built streaming-first with a gaming focus. YouTube added streaming to its massive video platform. Your choice depends on content type, audience goals, and how streaming fits your broader creator strategy.

content.title: Discoverability
content.description: YouTube's algorithm recommends streams and VODs, driving new viewers.

content.title: VOD Power
content.description: Stream archives become searchable videos that keep getting views.

content.title: Better Revenue Split
content.description: 70/30 split for memberships beats Twitch's 50/50 for most creators.

content.title: Stream Culture
content.description: Purpose-built for streaming with established community expectations.

content.title: Chat Features
content.description: Superior chat tools, emotes, and community features.

content.title: Lower Barrier
content.description: Easier to start monetizing with just 50 followers for affiliate.

sections.title: Choose YouTube Streaming If
content: You already have a YouTube audience
You want VODs to rank in search
You create diverse content (not just gaming)

sections.title: Choose Twitch If
content: Chat interaction is crucial to your content
You need faster path to monetization

faq.question: Can I stream on both platforms?
faq.answer: Twitch Partners have exclusivity clauses. Affiliates have 24-hour exclusivity. If you're not partnered, multistreaming to both is possible.

faq.question: Which pays better?
faq.answer: YouTube's 70/30 split beats Twitch's standard 50/50. However, Twitch's lower monetization threshold means faster first income. Long-term, YouTube often pays better.

faq.question: Which has better discoverability?
faq.answer: YouTube by far. YouTube recommends streams and VODs through search and algorithm. Twitch discovery is mostly through directory browsing.

faq.question: Is Twitch dying?
faq.answer: No, but competition is increasing. YouTube Gaming is growing fast. Many creators now multistream or move to YouTube for better terms and discoverability.
